description: After learning of suppressed histories in Halden Zones, Rada chooses to secretly spotlight the Memory Markets, ignoring Council warnings and gathering hand-written diaries, sketches, and testimonies from affected citizens.

Rada launches a feature series via underground channels, urging residents to reclaim and share erased memories. Her call for participation marks a clear public challenge to Council narratives and sparks widespread discussion.

Inspired by Rada's campaign, residents in Halden Zones openly organize Memory Markets—physical spaces for exchanging hand-written stories and art, quickly gaining momentum as digital oversight falters.

Council attempts to label Memory Markets as 'unauthorized gatherings' and deploys agents to infiltrate them. Their exposure is widely publicized, prompting further public backlash and mass participation—even in restricted areas.
Council intelligence reports reveal Memory Markets now spread across multiple districts, severely weakening the BCI’s hold on collective memory and undermining official authority.
